intro: Distephanus biafrae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Distephanus biafrae is widely cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
